intro: Xylorhiza glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed xylorhiza, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender, smooth stems that are often hairless. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly rough texture. Xylorhiza glabriuscula thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
